intro: Uragoga semifissa, commonly known as the slender uraranga, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Araceae, which includes many plants with showy inflorescences. The plant features a short, erect stem with broad, heart-shaped leaves that are often covered in a fine, waxy coating. Its flowers are clustered in a spadix, surrounded by a modified leaf called a spathe, typical of the arum family. Uragoga semifissa is often cultivated for its ornamental value due to its striking foliage and unique floral structure.
